verses.verse: Like snow <S%H7950><s%> in summer, <S%H7019><s%> and as rain <S%H4306><s%> in harvest, <S%H7105><s%> so honor <S%H3519><s%> is not fitting <S%H5000><s%> for a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
Like a fluttering <S%H5110><s%> sparrow, <S%H6833><s%> like a darting <S%H5774><s%> swallow, <S%H1866><s%> so the undeserved curse <S%H7045><s%> doesn't <S%H935><s%> come to rest. <S%H935><s%>
A whip <S%H7752><s%> is for the horse, <S%H5483><s%> a bridle <S%H4964><s%> for the donkey, <S%H2543><s%> and a rod <S%H7626><s%> for the back <S%H1460><s%> of fools! <S%H3684><s%>
Don't <S%H6030><s%> answer a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly, <S%H200><s%> lest you also be like him. <S%H7737><s%>
Answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly, <S%H200><s%> lest he be wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

One who sends <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> is cutting off <S%H7096><s%> feet <S%H7272><s%> and drinking <S%H8354><s%> violence. <S%H2555><s%>
Like the legs <S%H7785><s%> of the lame <S%H6455><s%> that hang loose: <S%H1809><s%> so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
As one who binds <S%H6872><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> in a sling, <S%H4773><s%> so is he who gives <S%H5414><s%> honor <S%H3519><s%> to a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
Like a thornbush <S%H2336><s%> that goes <S%H5927><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a drunkard, <S%H7910><s%> so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
As an archer <S%H7227><s%> who wounds <S%H2342><s%> all, <S%H7936><s%> so is he who hires a fool <S%H3684><s%> or he who hires <S%H7936><s%> those who pass by. <S%H5674><s%>
As a dog <S%H3611><s%> that returns <S%H7725><s%> to his vomit, <S%H6892><s%> so is a fool <S%H3684><s%> who repeats <S%H8138><s%> his folly. <S%H200><s%>
Do you see <S%H7200><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes? <S%H5869><s%> There is more hope <S%H8615><s%> for a fool than for him. <S%H3684><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> "There is a lion <S%H7826><s%> in the road! <S%H1870><s%> A fierce lion <S%H7826><s%> roams the streets! <S%H7339><s%>"
As the door <S%H1817><s%> turns <S%H5437><s%> on its hinges, <S%H6735><s%> so does the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> on his bed. <S%H4296><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> buries <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in the dish. <S%H6747><s%> He is too lazy <S%H3811><s%> to bring it back <S%H7725><s%> to his mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> is wiser <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%> than seven men <S%H7651><s%> who answer <S%H7725><s%> with discretion. <S%H2940><s%>
Like one who grabs <S%H2388><s%> a dog <S%H3611><s%>'s ears <S%H241><s%> is one who passes by <S%H5674><s%> and meddles <S%H5674><s%> in a quarrel not his own. <S%H7379><s%>
Like a madman <S%H3856><s%> who shoots <S%H3384><s%> torches, <S%H2131><s%> arrows, <S%H2671><s%> and death, <S%H4194><s%>
is the man <S%H376><s%> who deceives <S%H7411><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> and says, <S%H559><s%> "Am I not joking? <S%H7832><s%>"
For lack <S%H657><s%> of wood <S%H6086><s%> a fire <S%H784><s%> goes out. <S%H3518><s%> Without gossip, <S%H5372><s%> a quarrel <S%H4066><s%> dies down. <S%H8367><s%>
As coals <S%H6352><s%> are to hot embers, <S%H1513><s%> and wood <S%H6086><s%> to fire, <S%H784><s%> so is a contentious <S%H4079><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to kindling <S%H2787><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a whisperer <S%H5372><s%> are as dainty morsels, <S%H3859><s%> they go down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost <S%H990><s%> parts. <S%H2315><s%>

Like silver <S%H3701><s%> dross <S%H5509><s%> on <S%H6823><s%> an earthen <S%H2789><s%> vessel are the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a fervent <S%H1814><s%> one with an evil <S%H7451><s%> heart. <S%H3820><s%>
A malicious <S%H8130><s%> man disguises <S%H5234><s%> himself with his lips, <S%H8193><s%> but he harbors <S%H7896><s%> evil <S%H4820><s%> in his heart. <S%H7130><s%>
When his speech <S%H6963><s%> is charming, <S%H2603><s%> don't <S%H539><s%> believe him; <S%H7651><s%> for there are seven abominations <S%H8441><s%> in his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
His malice <S%H8135><s%> may be concealed <S%H3680><s%> by deception, <S%H4860><s%> but his wickedness <S%H7451><s%> will be exposed <S%H1540><s%> in the assembly. <S%H6951><s%>
Whoever digs <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H7845><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into it. <S%H1556><s%> Whoever rolls a stone, <S%H68><s%> it will come back on him. <S%H7725><s%>
A lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> those it hurts; <S%H1790><s%> and a flattering <S%H2509><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> works <S%H6213><s%> ruin. <S%H4072><s%>
